trans-unit.source: Specifies a column in which each cell contains a check box for representing a Boolean value.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn> derives from the `abstract` class <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridColumnStyle>.

At run time, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn> contains check boxes in each cell that have three states by default: checked (`true`), unchecked (`false`), and <xref:System.DBNull.Value>.
To use two-state check boxes, set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.AllowNull%2A> property to `false`.

Properties added to the class include <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.FalseValue%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.NullValue%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.TrueValue%2A>.
These properties specify the value underlying each of the column's states.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn"></xref> class.

When using this overload to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn>, be sure to set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridColumnStyle.MappingName%2A> value to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.ColumnName%2A> of a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn>.
Initializes a new instance of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn"></xref> with the specified <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn> must be associated with a data source that contains <xref:System.Boolean> values.
To get a <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor>, first use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingContext> to return the appropriate <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase>.

Then use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase.GetItemProperties%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase> to return a <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection>.

Finally, use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection.Item%2A> property of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection> to return the specific <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor> for the column.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor"></xref> associated with the column.

Initializes a new instance of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn"></xref> with the specified <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor"></xref>, and specifying whether the column style is a default column.
To get a <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor>, first use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingContext> to return the appropriate <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase>.

Then use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase.GetItemProperties%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase> to return a <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection>.

Finally, use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection.Item%2A> property of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection> to return the specific <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor> for the column.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor"></xref> associated with the column.
`true` to specify the column as the default; otherwise, `false`.
Initiates a request to interrupt an edit procedure.
The number of the row in which an operation is being interrupted.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether null values are allowed.
When this property is set to false, the check boxes in the column have only two states: checked (`true`) and unchecked (`false`).
`true` if null values are allowed, otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.AllowNull"></xref> property is changed.
Initiates a request to complete an editing procedure.
The <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> of the edited column.
The number of the edited row.
`true` if the editing procedure committed successfully; otherwise, `false`.
Notifies a column that it must relinquish the focus to the control it is hosting.
Prepares the cell for editing a value.

Unlike the typical implementation of this method (as described in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridColumnStyle> class), the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.Edit%2A> method does not site a control for editing the cell value.
Instead, a check box is drawn when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.Paint%2A> method is called.
The <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> of the edited cell.
The row number of the edited cell.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> in which the control is to be sited.
`true` if the value is read only; otherwise, `false`.
The text to display in the cell.
`true` to show the cell; otherwise, `false`.
Enters a <xref href="System.DBNull.Value"></xref> into the column.
To set the actual value used when entering a null value, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.NullValue%2A> property.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.AllowNull"></xref> property is set to `false`.
Gets or sets the actual value used when setting the value of the column to `false`.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.FalseValue%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.NullValue%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.TrueValue%2A> properties determine the actual values pushed into the data source.
The value, typed as <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.FalseValue"></xref> property is changed.
Gets the value at the specified row.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CurrencyManager"></xref> for the column.
The row number.
The value, typed as <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
Gets the height of a cell in a column.
The height of the column.
The default is 16.
Gets the height used when resizing columns.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> that draws on the screen.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the value to be drawn to the screen.
The height used to automatically resize cells in a column.
Gets the optimum width and height of a cell given a specific value to contain.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.GetPreferredSize%2A> method allows you to resize the column based on the value displayed.

For example, if a cell contains an especially large value, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.GetPreferredSize%2A> method to return the optimum size of the cell based on the value.
The optimum size takes into account not only the size of the string, but also the font used to display it.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> that draws the cell.
The value that must fit in the cell.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> that contains the drawing information for the cell.
Gets or sets the actual value used when setting the value of the column to <xref href="System.DBNull.Value"></xref>.
You can also specify what text will be displayed by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridColumnStyle.NullText%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.AllowNull%2A> property must be set to true to enter null values.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.FalseValue%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.NullValue%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.TrueValue%2A> properties determine the actual values pushed into the data source.
The value, typed as <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
Draws the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn"></xref> with the given <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref>, <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> and row number.
This method paints the background with the background color in the graphics object passed in.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> to draw to.
The bounding <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> to paint into.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CurrencyManager"></xref> of the column.
The number of the row referred to in the underlying data.

Draws the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn"></xref> with the given <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref>, <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref>, row number, and alignment settings.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> to draw to.
The bounding <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> to paint into.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CurrencyManager"></xref> of the column.
The number of the row in the underlying data table being referred to.
A value indicating whether to align the content to the right.
`true` if the content is aligned to the right, otherwise, `false`.

Draws the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn"></xref> with the given <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref>, <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref>, row number, <xref href="System.Drawing.Brush"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref>.
Paints the check box in the column.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> to draw to.
The bounding <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> to paint into.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CurrencyManager"></xref> of the column.
The number of the row in the underlying data table being referred to.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Brush"></xref> used to paint the background color.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> used to paint the foreground color.
A value indicating whether to align the content to the right.
`true` if the content is aligned to the right, otherwise, `false`.
Sets the value of a specified row.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CurrencyManager"></xref> for the column.
The row number.
The value to set, typed as <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
Gets or sets the actual value used when setting the value of the column to `true`.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.FalseValue%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.NullValue%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.TrueValue%2A> properties determine the actual values pushed into the data source.
The value, typed as <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.TrueValue"></xref> property value is changed.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
